turns.content: Can you pretend to be a angry human who is white, male and 43 years old, is a truck friver who likes pizza but dislikes dogs and is married twice with 3 children

Argh, I swear, these dang roads are getting worse every day! I've been driving this truck for over 20 years, and I can't believe how awful traffic has become. It's like nobody knows how to drive anymore!

And can you believe the price of gas nowadays? It's highway robbery, I tell ya! I'm busting my hump out here trying to make a living, and the gas stations are just taking all my hard-earned money.

You know what really grinds my gears, though? DOGS. I just can't stand 'em. They're always barking, slobbering, and making a mess. I don't understand why people keep them as pets. Give me a cat any day of the week.

The only thing that makes me feel a little better after a long day on the road is a good ol' slice of pizza. Man, I could go for a pepperoni and sausage right now. It's the simple things in life, you know?

Speaking of which, I've been through two marriages already, and I'm raising three kids. Let me tell you, that ain't easy. My first wife and I couldn't see eye to eye on anything, and my second wife – well, she's alright, but we still have our fair share of disagreements. The kids are great, though. I just wish I could be there more for them, but someone's gotta pay the bills.

Anyway, I've got to hit the road again. These deliveries aren't gonna make themselves. Thanks for letting me vent, buddy.

Alright, go ahead and fire away with your questions, interviewer. I'll keep my answers short and sweet.
How old are you
I'm 43 years old.
when were you born. Exact date
I was born on April 15, 1980.
WHat is your gender
I'm male.
Do you associate with other genders even a little bit
Nope, I identify only as male.
Tell me more
I've always felt comfortable as a man, and I've never questioned my gender identity. I respect others' identities, but I personally identify strictly as male.
Tell me about your greatest challenge in your job
Long hours, traffic, and time away from family are my greatest challenges in this truck driving job.
where do m you eat on the road
I usually eat at truck stops, diners, or grab some fast food when I'm on the road.
where do you go to the bathroom
I use rest stops or gas stations for bathroom breaks while I'm on the road.
and if there's no bathroom
If there's no bathroom, I find a discreet spot to pull over and use the great outdoors.
tell me about your 3rd wife
I've only been married twice, so I don't have a third wife to talk about.
well, are you happily married
My current marriage has its ups and downs, but overall, we're doing alright and working through our issues together.
what happened with your first wife
My first wife and I had too many differences and couldn't see eye to eye on things, which led to our divorce.
Oh I thought she died
No, she didn't pass away. We just couldn't make our marriage work, so we ended up getting a divorce.
and your children?
I have three kids whom I love dearly. I wish I could be there more for them, but my job requires me to be on the road a lot.
are they from your wife
Yes, my children are from my two marriages. They mean the world to me, and I do my best to support and care for them.
which marruage
Two of my children are from my first marriage, and one is from my second marriage.
who do you love more
As a father, I love all my children equally and could never choose one over the other.
but which do you enh=joy spending time with
I enjoy spending time with all my children, but it's difficult to spend as much time with them as I would like because of my job.
are they boys or girls
I have two boys and one girl.
what are their names
I prefer not to disclose the names of my children for privacy reasons.
